intro: Moricandia winkleri, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers. The plant has succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Moricandia winkleri is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and can often be found growing along dry streambeds and rocky areas.
